title: Gold Coast motorist who paid for all-day-parking is FINED $80 due to glitch in booking app
text:
A motorist has been stung with a nasty parking fine despite paying for an all-day spot.

David Henderson paid $6.60 for an all-day parking spot on Cloyne Road, Southport, in Queensland via the council's EasyPark app at about 9am on Thursday.

But he was slapped with an $80 fine through a notice, which claimed he had failed to pay for his parking spot upon returning to his car at 2.30pm.

Mr Henderson said he had complained to the City of Gold Coast Council, who he claimed told him they are 'unlikely' to waive the fine.

David Henderson was slapped with an $80 fine (left), despite paying for an all-day parking spot via the council's EasyPark app (right)

He was fined due to a glitch in the app, which registered his Cloyne Road parking spot for Marshall Lane, which is just metres away, the Gold Coast Bulletin reported.

The app, which was launched by the council on August 1, can be used by motorists in parts of the city where parking meters have been removed.

The parking spot is able to be detected through the app, which will deduct money from the motorist once they confirm it.

'They know that I paid for parking, but still continued to give me the infringement. It's ridiculous,' Mr Henderson said.

'Obviously the app is inefficient and can't identify where you are.

'I believe they should at least look at the situation and get back to the people that have made the app to refine it, there's an issue there.'

Mr Henderon was fined due to a glitch in the app, which registered his Cloyne Road parking spot for Marshall Lane, which is just metres away

A spokesman for the council said parking fine appeals are dealt with on a case-to-case basis with the City's Penalty Infringement Review Policy.

Mr Henderson said he would've happily paid for the fine if he was in the wrong.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted the City of Gold Coast Council for further comment.
